annotation:
ssh user@debian-stable-vmWelcome to Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)!Connecting to a Debian Stable virtual machine via SSH.uname -r5.10.0-19-amd64Checking the kernel version of the Debian Stable VM.sudo apt updateGet:1 http://deb.debian.org/debian stable InRelease [113 kB]Updating package lists for the latest version of packages in Debian Stable repositories.sudo apt install -y build-essentialReading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree... Done
Reading state information... DoneInstalling the essential build tools such as `gcc`, `make`, etc., required for compiling GNU software.sudo apt install -y wget lynxReading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree... Done
Reading state information... DoneInstalling `wget` and `lynx` utilities for downloading and interacting with web resources.wget https://ftp.gnu.org/gnu/hello/hello-2.10.tar.gz--2024-11-14 14:20:04-- https://ftp.gnu.org/gnu/hello/hello-2.10.tar.gz
Resolving ftp.gnu.org (ftp.gnu.org)... 209.51.188.172Downloading the latest version of the GNU Hello program's source code using `wget`.tar -xvzf hello-2.10.tar.gztar (child): hello-2.10.tar.gz: Cannot open: No such file or directory
tar (child): Error is not recoverable: exiting now
tar: Child returned status 2
tar: Error is not recoverable: exiting nowError encountered during the extraction step. The file is not found due to a wrong file path or the file not being downloaded properly.lshello-2.10.tar.gzThe user lists the contents of the directory to check if the file exists.tar -xvzf hello-2.10.tar.gzhello-2.10/
hello-2.10/README
hello-2.10/configure.acAfter verifying the file is present, the user successfully extracts the `hello-2.10.tar.gz` archive.cd hello-2.10Changing the working directory to the extracted folder of the Hello program's source code../configurechecking for a working C compiler... yes
checking for make... yes
checking whether make sets $(MAKE)... yesRunning the `configure` script to prepare the source code for compilation.makegcc -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -I. -I. -g -O2 -MT hello.o -MD -MP -MF .deps/hello.Tpo -c hello.c
gcc: error: unrecognized command line option ‘-MT’
make: *** [Makefile:486: hello.o] Error 1Error during the compilation process. The `gcc` compiler fails with an unrecognized command line option.make cleanrm -f hello.oRunning `make clean` to remove any partially compiled files before attempting the compilation again.sed -i 's/-MT/-c/' MakefileFixing the issue by modifying the Makefile to replace the incorrect `-MT` flag with `-c`.makegcc -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -I. -I. -g -O2 -c hello.c
gcc -g -O2 -o hello hello.oAfter modifying the Makefile, the user successfully compiles the program with the corrected flag.sudo make installinstalling `hello` in /usr/local/binInstalling the compiled `hello` program to the system using `make install`.helloHello, world!Running the newly installed GNU Hello program, which outputs "Hello, world!" to the terminal.cat /etc/apt/sources.listdeb http://deb.debian.org/debian/ stable main contrib non-free
deb-src http://deb.debian.org/debian/ stable main contrib non-freeChecking the current Debian Stable sources list to verify the package repositories.sudo apt upgradeReading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree... Done
Reading state information... Done
Calculating upgrade... Done
The following packages will be upgraded:Attempting to upgrade the current Debian Stable VM to the latest available packages from the Stable repositories.sudo apt install -t unstable helloReading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree... Done
Reading state information... Done
The following packages will be upgraded:Upgrading `hello` package to the latest version from the Unstable repository to obtain the latest GNU software features.helloHello, world!Running the newly upgraded version of the GNU Hello program to verify the upgrade was successful.exitEnding the SSH session after completing the deployment and installation of the GNU software.
